Class Database

java.lang.Object
webfx.devs.Database
public class Database extends Object
A simple SQLite-based database utility class designed to work with POJOs for schema generation and data insertion. It supports basic operations such as connecting to the database, creating tables, inserting records, and managing tables.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public static boolean connect(String directory, String filename)
      Establishes a connection to an SQLite database located in the user's home directory. It accepts a directory and filename and creates it if it does not exist.

      Directory can be the same the default ResourceManager directory, "webfx-external"

      Use of this class without calling this method requires updating the Connection Database.connection attribute

      Parameters:
      directory - , the name of the folder that contains the database file
      filename - , the name of the database file
      Returns:
      true if connection is successful, false otherwise

    • printTable

      public static void printTable(String tableName)
      Prints all records in the specified table to the console.
      Parameters:
      tableName - , the name of the table to print

    • createTable

      public static boolean createTable(String tableName, Class<?> clazz)
      Creates a table based on fields in a given class, with the given table name

      Fields declared as id is not permitted as there is an already existing Auto-Incrememented Primary Key Field, id.

      It is not recommended to annotate primitive fields with @Nullable. Only reference types (e.g., Integer, Double, String) should be marked as nullable, since primitives cannot represent null values.

      Parameters:
      tableName - , The name of the table
      clazz - , The class that we are mapping the table to
      Returns:
      true if creation is successful, false otherwise

    • dropTable

      public static boolean dropTable(String table)
      Drops the table with the specified name from the database.
      Parameters:
      table - , the name of the table to drop
      Returns:
      true if dropped successfully, false otherwise

    • deleteAll

      public static boolean deleteAll(String table)
      Deletes all rows from the specified table.
      Parameters:
      table - , the name of the table to clear
      Returns:
      true if deletion is successful, false otherwise

    • insert

      public static boolean insert(String table, Object record)
      Inserts a new record into the specified table using the fields and values of the given object. Only the non-null fields with @Nullable annotation will be included in the insert query.

      It is not recommended to annotate primitive fields with @Nullable. Only reference types (e.g., Integer, Double, String) should be marked as nullable, since primitives cannot represent null values.

      Parameters:
      table - , the name of the table
      record - , the object containing the data to insert
      Returns:
      true if insertion is successful, false otherwise

    • get

      public static Data get(String table, String id)
      Accepts an id and returns a Data representing that record in the database
      Parameters:
      table - The name of the table
      id - The id of the desired record
      Returns:
      A Data object containing the content of the retrieved record

    • getAll

      public static List<Data> getAll(String tableName, String whereClause, String... values)
      Retrieves all records from the specified table that match the provided WHERE clause and values.

      This method supports dynamic SQL filtering with parameterized inputs to ensure security and flexibility.

      Example Usage:

      
 // 1. Retrieve all users with the username "bob"
 List<Data> results1 = getAll("User", "username = ?", "bob");

 // 2. Retrieve all orders from a user with ID "42" and status "delivered"
 List<Data> results2 = getAll("Orders", "user_id = ? AND status = ?", "42", "delivered");

 // 3. Retrieve all employees with a salary greater than 50000
 List<Data> results3 = getAll("Employees", "salary > ?", "50000");
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the table to query from
      whereClause - the WHERE clause of the SQL statement (e.g. "username = ? AND age > ?")
      values - the values to substitute into the WHERE clause placeholders
      Returns:
      List<Data> object of each record in the returned from the query

    • getAll

      public List<Data> getAll(String tableName)
      Accepts the name of a table and returns all records in that table as List<Data>
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the table to query from
      Returns:
      List<Data> of all records
